item.title: Fallout London Mod Will Get Its Own DLC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/fallout-london-mod-will-get-its-own-dlc/1100-6528277/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Fallout 4 arrived nearly a decade ago, and it's anyone's guess when Fallout 5 will be released. Thankfully, the fan developers at Team Folon took it upon themselves to create Fallout London, an unofficial Fallout 4 mod that gives players a glimpse of the post-apocalypse in the United Kingdom. Now, Team Folon plans to go even further with an upcoming DLC release for Fallout London.

"What started as a simple hotfix has grown into something much bigger," said the team on the Fallout London Discord. "Given the scope of this update, we're aware it may make changes that impact save files, so rather than risking breaking things for a small update, we're looking to roll this into a part of our very first DLC!"

Specific details about the release date and what will be in the DLC weren't disclosed, but it was said to include new content as well as things that were cut from the original release of the mod. Additionally, Team Folon announced that it's no longer just a collective of fans, and the company is now incorporated as an official business. The team suggested that it may work on "a small indie game," but promised to "always continue to support Fallout London."

Earlier this year, Fallout London was downloaded 500,000 times in the first 24 hours, which is a record for the GOG store. Fallout London still has its own page outside of Discord, where more information about the mod can be found. Meanwhile, a separate team is working on another ambitious and unofficial Fallout 4 mod. Fallout: Nuevos Mexico doesn't currently have a release window, but it will explore what's happening in Mexico during the events of the Fallout games.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Rugrats: Adventures In Gameland For Switch Is 25% Off At Amazon On Launch Day
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/rugrats-adventures-in-gameland-for-switch-is-25-off-at-amazon-on-launch-day/1100-6528271/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The physical edition of Rugrats: Adventures in Gameland launches December 6, and Nintendo Switch users can save 10 bucks at Amazon. With the discount, the Switch edition of the new retro-style platformer is $30. Limited Run Games is also publishing a boxed edition for PS5, but it isn't eligible for the discount. We rarely see preorder or launch-day discounts like this at Amazon, so if you were thinking of picking up the new Rugrats game as a holiday gift, this is a nice (and surprising) offer.

Rugrats: Adventures in Gameland for Nintendo Switch

$30 (was $40) | Releases December 6

Rugrats: Adventures in Gameland is a simple 2D platformer where players explore six levels as the characters Tommy, Chucky, Phil, and Lil from the 90s cartoon. The game features single-player and co-op modes and two graphical options: a hand-drawn HD style that matches the look of the Rugrats cartoon and an 8-bit pixel option that turns the game into a classic NES-style platformer. While collectors will certainly be interested in the game, it's also a fun title for younger players, especially since the co-op mode lets parents and kids easily play together.

This actually isn't the only physical edition of Rugrats: Adventures in Gameland made by Limited Run Games. Earlier this year, the publisher had limited-edition Switch and PS5 versions with different cover art, and there were even two physical NES cart editions. All of those editions are sold out, so this new PS5 and Switch printing is currently the only way to secure a boxed copy of the game.

The $10 discount for the Switch cartridge version is nice, but it's worth noting that Adventures in Gameland is available for $25 on the Switch eShop, PlayStation Store, Xbox Store, and PC via Steam and Epic. The digital version launched on September 10.
